Against every evildoer God's law utters condemnation. He may disregard that voice, he may seek to drown its warning, but in vain. It follows him. It makes itself heard. It destroys his peace. If unheeded, it pursues him 
                                                                           145
to the grave. It bears witness against him at the judgment. A quenchless fire, it consumes at last soul and body.
